intro: Tetrameris viscidula, commonly known as the sticky tetrameris, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its sticky hairs on its stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Tetrameris viscidula is typically found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in dry conditions.
